conclusion: Analyze forces acting on each object and calculate new equilibrium positions after changing mass of object C.
System with three objects: A (mass 2m), B (mass 3m), connected by spring (constant k), rope over pulley connecting A and C (mass m), initially at rest.
Initially, system in equilibrium, forces on A and B balance. Tension in spring equals weight of A, spring force on B equals weight of B.
When mass of C changes to 5m, C descends slowly, system reaches new equilibrium. Weight of C is 5mg, tension in rope is 2mg.
For equilibrium, weight of A must equal tension in rope, so 2mg = 2mg.
Spring force on B must equal weight of B, so kx = 3mg, where x is compression of spring.
New equilibrium position of A determined by spring force, kx = 2mg.
Height that A rises is difference between new and initial positions, which is x = 2mg/k.
